event.title: Cycles
event.name: CPU Cycles
event.description: The counter increments on every cycle.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Increment PMSWINC Register
event.description: The counter increments on writes to the PMSWINC register.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Instruction Cache: Access' that causes a demand refill of any of the Level 1 caches outside the Level 1 caches of this PE. A refill includes any access that causes data to be fetched from outside the cache, even if the data is ultimately not allocated into the cache. For example, data might be fetched into a buffer but then discarded, rather than being allocated into a cache. These buffers are treated as part of the cache. If the cache is shared, only events attributable to this PE are counted. If the cache is not shared, all events are counted.

event.title: L1 Instruction TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts attributable instruction memory accesses that cause a TLB refill of at least the Level 1 instruction TLB. This includes each Instruction memory access that causes an access to a level of memory system due to a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Access' that causes a demand refill of at least the Level 1 data or unified cache from outside the Level 1 cache. Each access to a cache line that causes a new linefill is counted, including those from instructions that generate multiple accesses, such as load or store multiples, and PUSH and POP instructions. In particular, the counter counts accesses to the Level 1 cache that cause a refill that is satisfied by another Level 1 data or unified cache, or a Level 2 cache, or memory. A refill includes any access that causes data to be fetched from outside the cache, even if the data is ultimately not allocated into the cache. For example, data might be fetched into a buffer but then discarded, rather than being allocated into a cache. These buffers are treated as part of the cache.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts each memory read operation or memory write operation that causes a cache access to at least the Level 1 data or unified cache. If the cache is shared, only events attributable to this PE are counted. If the cache is not shared, all events are counted. Each access to a cache line is counted including the multiple accesses of instructions, such as LDM or STM . Each access to other Level 1 data or unified memory structures, for example refill buffers, write buffers, and write-back buffers, is also counted.

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each attributable memory read operation or attributable memory write operation that causes a TLB refill of at least the Level 1 data or unified TLB. It counts each read or write that causes a refill, in the form of a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Load
event.description: The counter increments for every executed memory-reading instruction.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Store
event.description: The counter increments for every executed memory-writing instruction. DC ZVA is counted as a store. The counter does not increment for a Store-Exclusive instruction that fails.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: All
event.description: The counter increments for every architecturally executed instruction.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Taken
event.description: The counter increments for each exception taken.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Exception Returns
event.description: The counter increments for each executed exception return instruction.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to CONTEXTIDR
event.description: The counter increments for every write to the CONTEXTIDR.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to PC
event.description: The counter increments for every software change of the PC. This includes all: Branch instructions, memory reading instructions that explicitly write to the PC, Data processing instructions that explicitly write to the PC, and Exception return instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Immediate)
event.description: The counter counts all immediate branch instructions that are architecturally executed.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Return)
event.description: The counter counts all procedure return instructions that are architecturally executed.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Unaligned Load/Store
event.description: The counter counts each memory-reading instruction or memory-writing instruction access that would generate an Alignment fault when Alignment fault checking is enabled.

event.title: Branch Predictor
event.name: Mispredictions
event.description: The counter counts each correction to the predicted program flow that occurs because of a misprediction from, or no prediction from, the branch prediction resources and that relates to instructions that the branch prediction resources are capable of predicting.

event.title: Branch Predictor
event.name: Possible Predictions
event.description: The counter counts every branch or other change in the program flow that the branch prediction resources are capable of predicting.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts memory read operations and memory write operations that the PE made. The counter increments whether the access results in an access to a Level 1 data or unified cache, a Level 2 data or unified cache, or neither of these.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts attributable instruction memory accesses that access at least the Level 1 instruction or unified cache. Each access to other Level 1 instruction memory structures, such as refill buffers, is also counted.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back
event.description: The counter counts every write-back of data from the Level 1 data or unified cache. The counter counts each write-back that causes data to be written from the Level 1 cache to outside of the Level 1 cache.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts each memory read operation or memory write operation that causes a cache access to at least the Level 2 data or unified cache. If the cache is shared, only events attributable to this PE are counted. If the cache is not shared, all events are counted.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L2 Data Cache: Access' that causes a refill of any of the Level 1 or Level 2 caches from outside the Level 1 and Level 2 caches of the PE. A refill includes any access that causes data to be fetched from outside the cache, even if the data is ultimately not allocated into the cache. For example, data might be fetched into a buffer but then discarded, rather than being allocated into a cache. These buffers are treated as part of the cache.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back
event.description: The counter counts every write-back of data from the Level 2 data or unified cache that occurs as a result of an operation by this PE. It counts each write-back that causes data to be written from the Level 2 cache to outside the Level 1 and Level 2 caches.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts memory read operations and memory write operations that access outside of the boundary of the PE and its closely-coupled caches. Where this boundary lies with respect to any implemented caches is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED.

event.title: Errors
event.name: Memory
event.description: The counter counts every occurrence of a memory error signaled by a memory closely coupled to this PE. The definition of local memories is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED but includes caches, tightly-coupled memories, and TLB arrays.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: All
event.description: The counter counts instructions that are speculatively executed by the PE. This includes instructions that are subsequently not architecturally executed.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to TTBR
event.description: The counter counts writes to the translation table base registers, TTBR0 and TTBR1.

event.title: Cycles
event.name: Bus Cycles
event.description: The counter increments on every cycle of the interface at the boundary of the PE and its closely-coupled caches. Where this boundary lies with respect to any implemented caches is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Allocation without refill
event.description: The counter increments on every attributable write that writes an entire line into the Level 2 cache without fetching from outside the Level 1 or Level 2 caches

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Any)
event.description: The counter counts all branches on the architecturally executed path that would incur cost if mispredicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Mispredicted)
event.description: The counter counts all instructions counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Any)' that were not correctly predicted.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend
event.description: The counter counts every cycle counted by the 'Cycles: CPU Cycles' event on which no operation was issued because there are no operations available to issue for this PE from the frontend.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend
event.description: The counter counts every cycle counted by the 'Cycles: CPU Cycles' event on which no operation was issued because either: The backend is unable to accept any of the operations available for issue for this PE, OR the backend is unable to accept any operations.

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts each attributable memory read operation or attributable memory write operation that causes a TLB access to at least the Level 1 data or unified TLB. Each access to a TLB record is counted including the multiple accesses of instructions, such as LDM or STM.

event.title: L1 Instruction TLB
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts each attributable Instruction memory access that causes a TLB access to at least the Level 1 instruction or unified TLB.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Allocation without refill
event.description: The counter increments on every attributable write that writes an entire line into the Level 3 cache without fetching from outside the Level 1, Level 2, or Level 3 cache.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L3 Data Cache: Access' which causes a demand refill of any of the Level 1, Level 2. or Level 3 caches from outside the Level 1, Level 2, and Level 3 caches. A refill includes any access that causes data to be fetched from outside the cache, even if the data is ultimately not allocated into the cache. For example, data might be fetched into a buffer but then discarded, rather than being allocated into a cache. These buffers are treated as part of the cache.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts each memory read operation or memory write operation that causes a cache access to at least the Level 3 data or unified cache. If the cache is shared, only events attributable to this PE are counted. If the cache is not shared, all events are counted. Each access to a cache line is counted including re fills of and write-backs from the Level 1 or Level 2 data, instruction, or unified caches. Each access to other Level 3 data or unified memory structures, such as refill buffers, write buffers, and write-back buffers, is also counted.

event.title: L2 Data TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each attributable memory read operation or attributable memory write operation that causes a TLB refill of at least the Level 2 data or unified TLB. It counts each attributable read or attributable write that causes a refill, in the form of a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching.

event.title: L2 Data TLB
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts each attributable memory read operation or attributable memory write operation that causes a TLB access to at least the Level 2 data or unified TLB. Each access to a TLB record is counted, including the multiple accesses of instructions such as LDM or STM.

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Translation table walk
event.description: The counter counts each attributable memory read or memory write operation that causes a refill of a data or unified TLB involving at least one translation table walk access. This includes each complete or partial translation table walk that causes an access to memory, including to data or translation table walk caches.

event.title: Instruction TLB
event.name: Translation table walk
event.description: The counter counts each attributable Instruction memory access that causes a refill of an instruction TLB, involving at least one translation table walk access. This includes each complete or partial translation table walk that causes an access to memory, including to data or translation table walk caches.

event.title: Last Level Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'Last Level Cache: Access', but counts only memory read accesses.

event.title: Last Level Cache
event.name: Miss (due to read)
event.description: As 'Last Level Cache: Miss', but counts only memory read operations.

event.title: Multi-socket Remote Access
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'Multi-socket Remote Access: Access', but counts only memory read operations.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Access', but counts only memory read accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Access', but counts only memory write accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to read)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Refill', but counts only memory read accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to write)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Refill', but counts only memory write accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (from inside cluster)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Refill', but counts only memory operations that generate refills satisfied by transfer from another cache inside of the immediate cluster.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (from outside cluster)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Refill', but counts only memory operations that generate refills satisfied by transfer from another cache outside of the immediate cluster.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'L2 Data Cache: Access', but counts only memory-read operations that access at least the Level 2 data or unified cache.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: As 'L2 Data Cache: Access', but counts only memory-write operations that access at least the Level 2 data or unified cache.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to read)
event.description: As 'L2 Data Cache: Refill', but counts only memory-read operations that cause a refill of at least the Level 2 data or unified cache.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to write)
event.description: As 'L2 Data Cache: Refill', but counts only memory-write operations that cause a refill of at least the Level 2 data or unified cache.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'Bus: Access', but counts only memory-read operations that access outside the boundary of the PE and its closely-coupled caches.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: As 'Bus: Access', but counts only memory-write operations that access outside the boundary of the PE and its closely-coupled caches.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'Memory: Access', but the counter counts only memory-read operations that the PE made.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: As 'Memory: Access', but the counter counts only memory-write operations that the PE made.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only memory-reading instructions, as defined by the 'Instructions (Executed): Load' event.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Store
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only memory-writing instructions, as defined by the 'Instructions (Executed): Store' event.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load/Store
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only memory-reading and memory-writing instructions, as defined by the 'Instructions (Executed): Load' and 'Instructions (Executed): Store' events.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Data Processing (Integer)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only integer data-processing instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Data Processing (Advanced SIMD)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only Advanced SIMD data-processing instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Data Processing (Floating-point)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only floating-point data-processing instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (software PC writes)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only software changes of the PC.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Crypto
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only Cryptographic instructions, except PMULL and VMULL.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (immediate)
event.description: The counter counts immediate branch instructions speculatively executed.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (return)
event.description: The counter counts procedure return instructions speculatively executed.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (indirect)
event.description: The counter counts indirect branch instructions speculatively executed. This includes software change of the PC other than exception-generating instructions and immediate branch instructions.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: IRQ
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions taken locally that are IRQ or Virtual IRQ exceptions.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: FIQ
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions taken locally that are FIQ or Virtual FIQ exceptions.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'L3 Data Cache: Access', but counts only attributable memory-read operations that cause a cache access to at least the Level 3 data or unified cache.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to read)
event.description: As 'L3 Data Cache: Refill', but counts only attributable memory-read operations that cause a refill of at least the Level 3 data or unified cache from outside the Level 3 cache.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to prefetch)
event.description: Level 3 cache refill due to prefetch.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to prefetch)
event.description: Level 2 cache refill due to prefetch.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to prefetch)
event.description: Level 1 data cache refill due to prefetch.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Write Streaming Mode
event.description: Level 2 cache write streaming mode.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Enter Write Streaming Mode
event.description: Level 1 data cache entering write streaming mode.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Write Streaming Mode
event.description: Level 1 data cache write streaming mode.

event.title: Errors
event.name: Pre-decode
event.description: Pre-decode error.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Write Streaming Mode
event.description: Level 3 cache write streaming mode.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Conditional)
event.description: Conditional branch that is executed.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Indirect, Mispredicted)
event.description: Indirect branch that is mis-predicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Indirect, Mispredicted Address)
event.description: Indirect branch that is mis-predicted because of address mis-compare.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Conditional, Mispredicted)
event.description: Conditional branch mis-predicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Indirect, Address predicted)
event.description: Indirect branch with predicted address executed.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Return, Address predicted)
event.description: Procedure return with predicted address executed.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Return, Mispredicted Address)
event.description: Procedure return mis-predicted due to address mis-compare.

event.title: L2 Data TLB
event.name: Access (Last Level Walk)
event.description: Level 2 TLB last-level walk cache access.

event.title: L2 Data TLB
event.name: Refill (Last Level Walk)
event.description: Level 2 TLB last-level walk cache refill.

event.title: L2 Data TLB
event.name: Access (Level 2 Walk)
event.description: Level 2 TLB level-2 walk cache access.

event.title: L2 Data TLB
event.name: Refill (Level 2 Walk)
event.description: Level 2 TLB level-2 walk cache refill.

event.title: L2 Data TLB
event.name: Access (IPA)
event.description: Level 2 TLB IPA cache access.

event.title: L2 Data TLB
event.name: Refill (IPA)
event.description: Level 2 TLB IPA cache refill.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Stash Dropped
event.description: Level 2 cache stash dropped.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Cache miss)
event.description: No operation issued due to the frontend, cache miss.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (TLB miss)
event.description: No operation issued due to the frontend, TLB miss.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Pre-decode error)
event.description: No operation issued due to the frontend, pre-decode error.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend interlock.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, AGU)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, interlock, AGU.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, FPU)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, interlock, FPU.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, Load)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, load.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, Store)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, store.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, Load, Cache-miss)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, load, cache miss.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, Load, TLB-miss)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, load, TLB miss.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, Store, STB full)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, store, STB full.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, Store, TLB-miss)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, store, TLB miss.
